tool.name: Scanpy MNN
tool.description: correct batch effects by matching mutual nearest neighbors
tool.command: #if $batch_key ln -s '${input_obj_file}' input.h5 && PYTHONIOENCODING=utf-8 scanpy-integrate mnn --batch-key '${batch_key}' #if $batch_layer --batch-layer '${batch_layer}' #end if #if $key_added --key-added '${key_added}' #end if #if $var_subset #set var_subsets = ' '.join(["--var-subset '{name}' '{values}'".format(**$v) for $v in $var_subset]) ${var_subsets} #if $settings.default == "false" #if $settings.n_neighbors --n-neighbors '${settings.n_neighbors}' #end if #if $settings.sigma --sigma '${settings.sigma}' #end if #if not $settings.cos_norm_in ${settings.cos_norm_in} #end if #if $settings.svd_dim --svd-dim '${settings.svd_dim}' #end if #if not $settings.var_adj ${settings.var_adj} #end if #if $settings.compute_angle ${settings.compute_angle} #end if #if $settings.svd_mode --svd-mode '${settings.svd_mode}' #end if #end if #end if @INPUT_OPTS@ @OUTPUT_OPTS@ #else echo "No batch variables passed, simply passing original input as output unchanged." && cp '${input_obj_file}' output.h5 #end if

param.name: batch_key
param.label: The name of the column in adata.obs that differentiates among experiments/batches.

param.name: batch_layer
param.label: Layer to batch correct. By default corrects the contents of .X.

param.name: key_added
param.label: Key under which to add the computed results.
param.help: By default a new layer will be created called 'mnn', 'mnn_{layer}' or 'mnn_{layer}_{key_added}' where those parameters were specified. A value of 'X' causes batch-corrected values to overwrite the original content of .X.

repeat.name: var_subset
repeat.title: The subset of vars (list of str) to be used when performing MNN correction

param.name: name
param.label: Name of the categorical variable to filter on

param.name: values
param.label: Category or comma-separated list of categories

param.name: sigma
param.label: Sigma
param.help: The bandwidth of the Gaussian smoothing kernel used to compute the correction vectors.

param.name: cos_norm_in
param.label: Perform cosine normalization prior to computing corrected expression values?

param.name: svd_dim
param.label: Number of dimensions to use for summarizing biological substructure within each batch.
param.help: If not set, biological components will not be removed from the correction vectors.

param.name: var_adj
param.label: Adjust variance of the correction vectors?
param.help: Note this step takes most computing time.

param.name: compute_angle
param.label: Compute the angle between each cellâ€™s correction vector and the biological subspace of the reference batch?

param.name: svd_mode
param.label: SVD mode
param.help: 'svd' computes SVD using a non-randomized SVD-via-ID algorithm, while 'rsvd' uses a randomized version. 'irlb' performs truncated SVD by implicitly restarted Lanczos bidiagonalization (forked from https://github.com/airysen/irlbpy).
